result.execSummary:
The defendant Kim Drake was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 1 day only if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must submit a DNA sample.

Any other conditions as deemed appropriate by P&P.

timeConds.notes: Huber allowed - can serve the sentence in any county in WI.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kim Drake in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:32 PM. Bennett has copy of PSI and the addendum that was filed on 9/25/15, no statements to be made. State has PSI and addendum that was filed on 9/25/15, has complied with victim notification requirements, one victim would like to speak. Victim makes statement (2:33 PM). State makes argument prior to recommondation - recommends 7.5 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 2.5 years of initial confinement followed by 5 years of Extended Supervision, with conditions of: full restitution plus 10% victim witness surcharge, garnishment of any and all accounts while incarcerated for the payment of the restitution. Bennett offers exhibit #1, received after no objections. Bennett makes final argument prior to sentencing - asks that if jail sentence is ordered that it be allowed to be served in another county, recommends probation with some conditional jail time and allow huber, asks court to follow the recommendation of the PSI, asks that $1000.00 of the bond be released to victim for restitution and the remaining $2,000.00 to be converted to attorney's fees. State - no agreement between counsel on the bond (being released for attorney fees). Drake withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 5 years with conditions of: 1 year in FC jail - or any companion jail - huber allowed, $77,000.00 restitution plus VW surcharge (amount in PSI) - credit for 1 day if revoked - report today, all other conditions left up to P&P as stated in PSI, submit DNA sample with surcharge assessed, right to appeal. State needs clarification of restitution. Court answers question. Court - bond - $1000.00 to deductible, $1000.00 to counsel and $1000.00 to insurance.
Addendum to PSI copied to DA and Defense Attorney per P&P agent AD. JA informed of filing and copies to parties.
addendum to PSI. P&P has copied to DA and defense attorney
Left voicemail @ DOC (agent Joe K) that PSI needs to be done 2 weeks prior to hearing that is scheduled on 8/25/15

Defendant Kim Drake in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:07 PM. State had previously rested at last hearing except for rebuttal. Bennett - no longer need to call its witness(es) - believe the restitution amount of $87,492.78 (encompasses the deductible for the tribe of $1000.00) can be provided to PSI writer and may work with the insurance company for some sort of reduction. State agrees - in essence the State will be representing the insurance company. Court makes statement, refers to ability to pay contrary to 973.20(14)(b) . Court continues matter, sets for SEH and would like PSI well in advance.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Kim Drake in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:27 AM. State - resitution that they have arrived at is $76,647.96 in cash and $10,844.76 in checks for a total restitution amount is $87,492.72. Court instructs parties on who has the burden of proof. State provides Court and defense with exhibit #25 (Captain Marvin's report). State calls Tim Murphy. Murphy sworn in at 9:31 AM. Direct exam by State. State offers exhibit #8 - deposit slip dated 1/17/14 (2nd deposit). Court receives exhibit #8 after no objections (9:24 AM). State offers exhibits #11 and #12 - internal tallies for deposit date of 1/8/14 and 1/9/14. Court receives exhibit #11 after no objections (9:37 AM). State offers exhibit #26 - Murphy's tally sheet. Court receives exhibit #26 after no objections. State offers exhibit #2 - first deposit slip from 1/10/14. Court receives exhibit #2 after no objections (9:43 AM). State offers exhibit #13 - internal tally for 1/10/14. Recess at 9:44 AM. Back on record at 9:48 AM with same appearances. Court receives exhibit #12 after no objections (9:49 PM). Court receives exhibit #13 after no objections (9:56 AM). State offers exhibit #3 - second deposit slip from 1/10/15. Court receives #3 after no objections (9:57 AM). State offers exhibit #4 - deposit slip from 1/13/14. State offers exhibit #14 - internal tally for 1/11/14. Court receives exhibit #14 after no objections (10:02 AM). State offers exhibit #15 - internal tally for 1/12/14. Court receives exhibits #4 and #15 after no objections (10:03 AM). State offers exhibit #16 - internal tally from 1/13/14. Court receives exhibit #16 after no objections (10:05 AM). State offers exhibit #5 - deposit slip for 1/14/14. Court receives exhibit #5 after no objections (10:06 AM). State offers exhibit #27 - internal tally from 1/14/14. Court receives exhibit #27 after no objections (10:07 AM). State offers exhibit #6 - desposit slip for 1/15/14 and exhibit #17 - internal tally for 1/15/14. Court receives exhibit #6 after no objections (10:09 AM). Recess at 10:11 AM. Back on record at 10:16 AM. State offers exhibit #28 - internal tally for 1/14/14. Court receives exhibit #28 after no objections (10:18 AM). State offers exhibit #17. Court receives exhibit #17 after no objections (10:19 AM). State offers exhibit #18 - internal tally for 1/16/14. Court receives exhibit #18 after no objections (10:20 AM). Court receives exhibit #8 after no objections. State offers exhibit #19 - internal tally for 1/17/14. Court receives exhibit #19 after no objections (10:23 AM). State offers exhibit #7 - first deposit slip for 1/17/14. Court receives exhibit #7 after no objections (10:25 AM). Back on record at 10:38 AM after a 10 minute recess. State offers exhibit #20 - second internal tally for 1/18/14. Court receives exhibit #20 after no objections (10:40 AM). State offers exhibit #9 - deposit slip for 1/18/14. State offers exhibit #21 - internal tally for 1/18/14. Court receives exhibit #21 after no objections (10:44 AM).  State offers exhibit #22 - internal tally for 1/20/14. Court receives exhibit #22 after no objections (10:48 AM). State offers exhibit #10 - deposit slip for 1/22/14. Court receives exhibit #10 after no objections (10:48 AM). State offers exhibit #23 - internal tally for 1/21/14. Court receives exhibit #23 after no objections (10:50 AM). State offers exhibit #24 - internal tally for 1/22/14. Court receives exhibit #24 after no objections (10:53 AM). State moves to have all exhibits received. Court receives all exhibits #1 - #28 at this time after no objections (10:57 AM). State offers exhibit #29 - deposit run down for 1 year prepared by Murphy. Court receives exhibit #29 after no objections (10:58 AM). Court questions witness. State follows up on Court's question with direct (11:02 AM). State offers exhibit #20 - reconciliation by Murphy (checks unaccounted for). No cross exam by Bennett. Murphy excused at 11:03 AM. State calls Thomas Walkner. Walkner sworn in at 11:04 AM. Direct exam by State. Cross exam by Bennett at 11:12 AM. Bennett asking for an adjournment to continue restitution hearing for stated reasons. Court asks questions of witness at 11:15 AM. No follow up to Court's questions. Walkner excused at 11:16 AM. State has no more witnesses. Bennett does want to offer evidence but would like to bring in a bank employee, has some records. State would then have a rebuttal witness. Off record for scheduling. Court sets for continued restitution hearing on 6/2/15 at 2:00 PM, backing up a JT. Court receives all offered exhibits after no objectons (11:24 AM). Court instructs Bennett to provide any documents that he has for his side of the case for the State. State will copy them. Court continues bond.  Restitution hearing scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Kim Drake in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:18 AM. State - G to #1 as alleged in amended information, DRI #2 and #3, restitution hearing prior to sentencing, PSI and free to argue, ($80,000.00 restitution request), no co-defendants. Bennett agrees. Court asks questions regarding the calculation of the restitution. Court dismisses and reads in counts #2 and #3. Drake pleads G to count #1 as alleged thru attorney. Court has plea questionnaire, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, orders PSI, set for sentencing hearing, continues bond. Off record for scheduling. Back on record regarding restitution amount. Court - amount of restitution to be known ahead of time, don't file PSI until after they have the benefit. Court sets for restitution hearing, sentencing hearing will be set later, needs witnessses and basis to come up with a hardened restitution number, would like agreed upon number.  Restitution hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Called at 8:44 AM. Chuck Simono appears in person, Brian Bennett appears telephonically as does Judge O'Melia. State has filed a motion to amend the information, Bennett objects to motion for stated reasons. State indicates that difference in the counts and not prejudicial to defense. Court will grant the motion and will sign the order prepared. Bennett enters NG plea to amended information. Court continues bond, currently set for 3-day JT on 3/18-3/20, standard MIL to be filed by counsel and will be heard the morning of trial unless  not standard, then will be heard day prior to trial. Adjourned at 8:48 AM.
and certificate of appearance - Jailer DB
and certificate of appearance - Captain JM
and certificate of appearance - Lieutenant AK

Attorney Brian F. Bennett appearing telephonically.   Charles Simono appears for the State of Wisconsin. Judge O'Melia appears telephonically from Oneida County. No othe appearances. Called at 8:38 AM. Court puts on the record the last teleconference. State puts information on the record in regards to the co-defendant and obstacles for next weeks jury trial and if he will testify at this trial, states co-defendant's attorney is not available until next Thursday. Bennett responds. Court responds. Court grants motions by counsel to adjourn the JT for further investigation. Court continues bond and sets for 3 day JT. Adjourned at 8:59 AM.  Jury trial scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court in Oneida County.  Kim Drake does not appear. Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin via telephone. Judge O'Melia appears telephonically from Oneida County. Called at 1:33 PM. State puts new developments on the record. Bennett responds. Court responds - no ruling at this time, can set for another STC prior to JT if needed. Counsel to keep Court apprised.

Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court in Oneida Cty.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Judge O'Melia appears telephonically. Not called on the Record. Court - keeping the matter on the calendar for a JT at this point. Bennett responds and makes statement in regards to his situation and want for an adjournment of the JT. Court will not adjourn the matter, set for 4-day JT on 2/17 and Bennett will keep court updated.

Jury trial on February 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Called at 9:37 AM. Kim Drake appears in person and with counsel Brian Bennett. State appears by Charles Simono. Bennett - received extensive discovery, no offer yet. State responds, has previously made an oral agreement in regards to count #1. Bennett - 2 -3 day trial. Back on record, continues bond, set for JT on 2/17 thru 2/20/15, motions in limine to be filed by 2/3/15 and proposed jury instructions (numbers), if modified - send narratives. Adjourned at 9:42 AM.
Pre-trial conference on September 8, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Kim Drake in court/with attorney Brian F Bennett.  Jodie L Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 10:32 am. Bennett has information, waives reading pleads NG to all charges. Bond continued. PTC 9/8/14 @ 9:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Called at 3:03 PM. Kim Drake appears in person and with counsel Brian Bennett. State appears by Charles Simono. State calls Captain Jeff Marvin. Marvin sworn in at 3:04 PM. Bennett asks for sequestration of witnesses. Court so orders. Direct exam by State. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant. Cross exam by Bennett at 3:16 PM. Court has questions of witness. Bennett has follow up question to court's question (3:24 PM). Court has another follow question. State has follow up question for witness on court's question (3:25 PM). Marvin excused at 3:26 PM. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed, binds over for trial. Court continues bond, set for ARGN on 3/26/14 at 10:30 AM.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
Preliminary hearing on March 19, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
To attorney Brian Bennett per bond hearing held on 2/7/14.
